raster ini file

Read the configuration file in raw list form, you can use either the filename (.grd) or a raster object.

ini_file(x)

# S3 method for character
ini_file(x)

# S3 method for BasicRaster
ini_file(x)

Arguments

x

file name or raster

Examples

f <- system.file("extdata", "raster", "sst.grd", package  = "ffraster")
ini_file(f)
#> $general
#> $general$creator
#> [1] "R package 'raster'"
#> 
#> $general$created
#> [1] "2017-06-04 01:04:46"
#> 
#> 
#> $georeference
#> $georeference$nrows
#> [1] "16"
#> 
#> $georeference$ncols
#> [1] "8"
#> 
#> $georeference$xmin
#> [1] "143"
#> 
#> $georeference$ymin
#> [1] "-47"
#> 
#> $georeference$xmax
#> [1] "145"
#> 
#> $georeference$ymax
#> [1] "-43"
#> 
#> $georeference$projection
#> [1] "+proj"
#> 
#> 
#> $data
#> $data$datatype
#> [1] "FLT8S"
#> 
#> $data$byteorder
#> [1] "little"
#> 
#> $data$nbands
#> [1] "10"
#> 
#> $data$bandorder
#> [1] "BIL"
#> 
#> $data$minvalue
#> [1] "10.9699997548014:11.8899997342378:11.9099997337908:11.8799997344613:11.5099997427315:11.5799997411668:11.5599997416139:11.76999973692:11.6699997391552:11.5899997409433"
#> 
#> $data$maxvalue
#> [1] "13.9199996888638:14.4399996772408:13.9999996870756:13.9599996879697:14.3899996783584:14.1199996843934:13.7299996931106:13.9199996888638:13.7699996922165:13.6699996944517"
#> 
#> $data$nodatavalue
#> [1] "-1.7e+308"
#>
